24/7 Alarm Monitoring

Having a monitored alarm system significantly can reduce the risk of being the victim of a burglary. Protect your home and family with 24/7 home security and protection.

Landline Monitoring

Landline monitoring is the most common type of monitoring but also the oldest. Land line monitoring is provided by connecting your alarm system to your home phone through a phone-jack. The system then sends signals using your home phone connection and communicates with the monitoring station.

Broadband Monitoring

Broadband monitoring is when your alarm system is connected using your router or connection for your internet. Broadband is actually the quickest form of home security monitoring and sends a signal to the monitoring station almost instantly when an alarm is triggered. With most people getting rid of their home phone, this is a perfect option if you only have internet at home.

Cellular Monitoring

Cellular monitoring is the newest and most up to date way of securing your home. With cellular monitoring there is no need for a home phone, internet, or any wiring. Simply connect your cellular monitored security system to power, and it will automatically send signals as long as you are in a covered area. Cellular monitoring is powered by a GSM module built inside the actual alarm system which communicates with the monitoring station wirelessly. Itâ€™s the new way of protecting your home.
